```{r, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  results='asis',
  echo = FALSE
)

library(magrittr) # For the pipe
source("cv_printing_functions.r")

# Read in all data and initialize a CV printer object
CV <- create_CV_object(
  data_location = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iBxpNzwZWOrOwR__Y4FNDQ_3tpw-0trS0PVigsS4z6w/edit?usp=sharing",  
  pdf_mode = params$pdf_mode
)


CV$entries_data <- CV$entries_data %>% dplyr::filter(in_resume == TRUE)



```

}
</style>")
}

Main
================================================================================

Beatriz Milz {#title}
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello!  I'm a Doctorate Student in Environmental Science, and I'm an enthusiast of the programming language R, of open source and reproducible research.

I'm also active in the local R community: I'm a co-organizer of R-Ladies São Paulo, and I have taught in several meetups and workshops, 
in the chapter São Paulo and also at R-Ladies Niterói, Curitiba and Goiânia.
I'm also a co-organizer of SatRdays São Paulo, and a certified Carpentries Instructor.
